verses.roman:
kalāra śaralāte, śayana, ati kṣīṇa kāya
śaralāte hāḍa lāge, vyathā haya gāya

synonyms: kalāra śaralāte—on the dry bark of a plantain tree; śayana—lying down; ati—very; kṣīṇa kāya—skinny body; śaralāte—on the dry bark of a plantain tree; hāḍa lāge—bones contact; vyathā—pain; haya—is; gāya—in the body.
translation: Because He was very thin, when He lay down to rest on the dry bark of plantain trees, it caused Him pain in His bones.
